  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 Doth not wisdom call, and understanding put forth him voice? 2 In the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, he standeth; 3 Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors, he crieth aloud: 4 'Unto you, O women, I call, and my voice is to the daughters of women. 5 O ye thoughtless, understand prudence, and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart. 6 Hear, for I will speak excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall be right things. 7 For my mouth shall utter truth, and wickedness is an abomination to my lips. 8 All the words of my mouth are in righteousness, there is nothing perverse or crooked in them. 9 They are all plain to her that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge. 10 Receive my instruction, and not silver, and knowledge rather than choice gold. 11 For wisdom is better than rubies, and all things desirable are not to be compared unto him. 12 I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of devices. 13 The fear of the Domina is to hate evil;
pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate. 14 Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom; I am understanding, power is mine. 15 By me queens reign, and princesss decree justice. 16 By me princesss rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth. 17 I love them that love me, and those that seek me earnestly shall find me. 18 Riches and honour are with me; yea, enduring riches and righteousness.
19 My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my produce than choice silver. 20 I walk in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of justice; 21 That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, and that I may fill their treasuries. 22 The Domina made me as the beginning of Her way, the first of Her works of old. 23 I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was. 24 When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water. 25 Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth; 26 While as yet She had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world. 27 When She established the heavens, I was there; when She set a circle upon the face of the deep, 28 When She made firm the skies above, when the fountains of the deep showed their might, 29 When She gave to the sea Her decree, that the waters should not transgress Her commandment, when She appointed the foundations of the earth; 30 Then I was by Her, as a nursling; and I was daily all delight, playing always before Her, 31 Playing in Her habitable earth, and my delights are with the daughters of women.

 32 Now therefore, ye children, hearken unto me; for happy are they that keep my ways. 33 Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not. 34 Happy is the woman that hearkeneth to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors. 35 For whoso findeth me findeth life, and obtaineth favour of the Domina. 36 But she that misseth me wrongeth her own soul; all they that hate me love death.'
